Robert Scott, Superintendent

While COVID-19 pandemic may have ended the Avon Lake High School’s run for another national math championship, the students were able to participate this spring in an online Math Madness tournament in the spirit of fun, friendly competition. 29 students participated from their homes.

In other Math Club news…. Two members of the team (seniors Irwin Deng and Ryan Keller) qualified for the AIME (American Invitational Mathematics Examination) based on their impressive performances in the AMC 12 competition.
In the OCTM state tournament of mathematics, Avon Lake finished 13th overall in the state and 3rd in Division 3, with three members (senior Irwin Deng and juniors Tommy Polakowski and Nate Thain) qualifying for OHMIO, the Ohio Math Invitational Olympiad (Top 100 in OH get invited). Irwin Deng had a near perfect 39 / 40 in the tournament.

Avon Lake High School has been named the 2020 Lorain County Academic Champion of the Scholastic Games radio quiz series on Elyria's WEOL (AM930 and FM100.3). School closings due to COVID-19 halted this year's playoffs, but producers were able to name a winning school even without all the usual elimination rounds. Fortunately, all 16 scheduled teams were able to compete.

Team members are Cara Buck, Irwin Deng, and Eva Ferrari.
Irwin Deng, was also named a "Standout Scholar."

CONGRATULATIONS!

Sponsored by the Educational Service Center of Lorain County, the quiz series enjoys continued sponsorship from Nordson Corporation, as well as long-term support from funds of the Community Foundation of Lorain County, the Nord Family Foundation and the Community West Foundation. Philanthropic funds supporting the program this year include the Alfred T. Askew Fund, the Mercedes Campana Memorial Fund, the Ruth and Ted Jacobs Fund, the Miclat Family Fund and the Stocker Foundation Fund.

The new mural - just a tease of it in the picture below - will be on display permanently and include additional magnetized bottle caps and a large activity board, for kids to craft their own mural.

The Library is a proud partner and supporter of projects like this and we are thrilled to have a new display in DiscoveryWorks! Our thanks goes out also not just to Katherine, but we are grateful for the outpouring of support by the community who brought in literally 1,000’s of bottle caps over two months this fall to help make this project a reality.
#ALexcellence

Erieview Elementary School Kids in the Community members will be participating in Trick-or-Treat for UNICEF. This is a decades-old program where children bring along a little orange box during Trick-or-Treat to try and raise money for UNICEF. UNICEF is the United Nations International Children’s Emergency Fund, and their programs are varied and far-reaching. They provide clean water, medicine, vaccines, support for schools, and much more in countries all around the globe. Donations as small as $1 can provide safe water to a child for more than 2 months!

So, if a child trick-or-treats at your house for candy, AND for UNICEF, please consider a donation, no matter how small. Last year, we were able to donate almost $300 as a group and we hope to surpass that this year! If you don’t live near Erieview, but you’d like to donate, please contact Kathy Walker, leader of the group at Katherine.walker@avonlakecityschools.org

Happy Halloween, and thank you!
Erieview Kids in the Community

Avon Lake and surrounding communities' senior citizens are invited "back-to-school" Nov. 6 for the North Coast Rotary's first-ever Senior University event.

The event takes place from 9 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. Nov. 6 at Avon Lake High School, 175 Avon Belden Road, senior citizens have the opportunity to select two of 14 "classes" at the school. Class topics include: "Avon Lake - Then and Now," "Avoiding Scams This Holiday Season," "Fit & Fabulous Chair Exercises," "New Technology for Your Old Photographs," and many others. The event also features a keynote address from Bob DiBiasio, senior vice president of public affairs for the Cleveland Indians.

Cost is $15 and includes lunch featuring a performance from the Avon Lake High School Jazz Band. For more information, contact Becki Russell at 440- 930-6752 or rrussell@sprengerhealthcare.com. Registration is available online at northcoastrotary.org/senioruniversity.

The event is aimed to connect older residents with younger students, as well as provide resources and information for seniors.
